intro: Scandix australis subsp. balcanica, commonly known as the Balkan scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Scandix australis subsp. balcanica is known for its medicinal properties, particularly for its high vitamin C content.
